node.title: Nike Cancels Orders Until Summer '22 as Supply Chain Issues Wreak Havoc on Holiday Shopping
node.alt: Nike has canceled orders until summer 2022, according to an email reportedly sent from the company. In this photo, people are seen lining up to enter and exiting the Nike store on Boxing Day at McArthurGlen Designer Outlet Vancouver Airport on December 26, 2020, in Richmond, British Columbia, Canada.
node.description: Any holiday orders from Nike that haven't been shipped will not be fulfilled, the athletic apparel retailer said in an email.
node.content:
["Nike has cancelled orders until summer 2022 as supply chain issues wreak havoc on holiday shopping.", "In a tweet shared by Brendan Dunne, co-host of the sneaker culture podcast Full Size Run on Tuesday evening, Nike reportedly wrote an email to a sneaker retailer announcing the cancellation.", "\"COVID-19 continues to impact the global supply chain and create transportation disturbances,\" the email began. \"As a result of this dynamic and unprecedented situation we regret to inform you that Nike Future orders in (spring 2022, Summer 2022), and the balance of (Holiday Season 2021) will be cancelled.\"", "This means any holiday orders that haven't been shipped will not be fulfilled.", "\"We understand that this decision is difficult to hear. Our goal is to resume supply as soon as possible,\" the email continued.", "", "
Nike has canceled orders until summer 2022, according to an email reportedly sent from the company. In this photo, people are seen lining up to enter and exiting the Nike store on Boxing Day at McArthurGlen Designer Outlet Vancouver Airport on December 26, 2020, in Richmond, British Columbia, Canada.
", "This is a breaking news story and will be updated as more information becomes available."]
